> I'm still not sure if saving as draft is the right solution. It seems more of a workaround as of now.
Ideally it should be solved with resiliency - but here it is a success for AEM - and backend call is success and fails in downstream..

> If it's a sync call
Sync-call it seems - as Shivendra mentioned that it fails 2-3 steps down their submission flow and AEM/user is not intimated..

If it's a sync call where the submission is failing then custom code should be improved to throw the exception to the source. In case of async calls this scenarios should not arise.
I'm still not sure if saving as draft is the right solution. It seems more of a workaround as of now.
They shared in last call that - at times submission failed 2-3 steps down the line - which end user/AEM is not aware of - and thus want to track all submissions - not just failing submissions.

> Shouldn't they be just implementing ETE form submit tests that run in their deployment pipeline?
+1 We did propose that.

To provide more context on the original issue...
>  When we were working with them on the VIP engagement - an incident happened when due to a code change - their service went down.. In VIP we helped make the code modular and readable - but due to that incident - they lost thousands of submissions in a few hours.
> With portal - they want to have a backup submission to draft - so that if something similar happens in future - they have the complete data - and can leverage to push data to original submit through manual process later on.

Just wondering if the problem can be with their code that results in submission failure then any customization for Save as draft code also may be prone to the failures (it seems they don't trust their code) 
Shouldn't they be just implementing ETE form submit tests that run in their deployment pipeline?

<@U04P75X4H1B> One thing which came to my mind, since they have PII concerns, data in Azure is by default encrypted at rest[0] and not in transit and in use. For transit we use https so we are good, and in use they can restrict the access to azure/blob/containers. Lets confirm with them once, if this works for them, if not then lets do pre-processor.
As during our call, they needed base 64 encoding which is not encryption and definitely will not resolve their PII concerns. And if preprocessor is encrypting form values and their rest service should decrypt that in same fashion and in that case they have to handle key management also.

[0] : <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-service-encryption>

<@U0213T59LMN> They are submitting to rest api. They have written custom submission for this.

Current requirement is that they want to save that data with submission.

Here is the background for this requirement:
In past, their submission starts failing due to some issue in their code base and they almost lost 3k submissions. They were looking for some solution where they can save this data when submission happens so that if submission fails, they can get those drafts and submit by themselves. For this, we recommend save as draft feature to them. And, after the portal demo most of their requirements met, its just that they want to encrypt/encode this data before pushing it to Azure. To achieve this use case, we are thinking to try out FDM pre processor.

<@W4RSW3ECC> We are thinking to try out FDM pre processor for this.
cc: <@WLWHN4TV3>

I hope the encryption would be required at rest and not at transit .

Here is a demo recording for the working of the WF model: <https://adobe-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/p/sakshatc/EapDE6bUy3xKjCfMBZkA8ZgBNlB4ZUzer9ccIO3tgvn5vg?nav=eyJyZWZlcnJhbEluZm8iOnsicmVmZXJyYWxBcHAiOiJPbmVEcml2ZUZvckJ1c2luZXNzIiwicmVmZXJyYWxBcHBQbGF0Zm9ybSI6IldlYiIsInJlZmVycmFsTW9kZSI6InZpZXciLCJyZWZlcnJhbFZpZXciOiJNeUZpbGVzTGlua0NvcHkifX0&e=5QHNaB|Custom_Approve_Review_Defer_Workflow.mov>

> • Are there any sample OSGI workflows for review, approval and rejection that can be shared with the customer?
<@U05DURMMBGV>: Please share the workflow we created for Cintas as a package
> • Can a OSGI workflow invoke another OSGI workflow and pass data between them? Basically, a sub-workflow and wait for its execution. I know there is a container component but we need more clarity on this.
There is also a process step which wait for external process to complete and decide on the next action - we can get more details on this requirement.
> • How can failed workflow instances can be recovered? If an OSGI workflow execution fails, is there a way to recover them?
Failed workflows can be found in the failed workflow tabs and can be executed from the same failed step - if the requirement is to replay the complete wf then it is not available

<@WE163TH43> Do they now have any clarity on how the remote service they want to use with FDM is designed?  In the last meeting, they mentioned it was still unclear to them.

I have already shared the FDM-related queries in email to them and waiting for their response, and we still need the following information from their side.(copy paste from email)
• What authentication mechanism and protocol are used by the remote service?
• Any document or something to show the schema definition of the service for example swagger endpoint or file for API etc.
• For a single Communication, Do we have a use case where it will connect with multiple remote services, for example using one service for fetching account details and other service for fetching personal information etc ?
• During discussions, we get to know that you need filtering on incoming data? Can you please provide some information about what kind of filtering it is?
Please let me know if they have shared any of the above information.

Here are some features they're looking for:
• *Filling forms with information from an ID or document:* Automatically pre-fill forms using verified sources to save time and reduce errors.
• *Real-time monitoring:* Track form completion and drop-off rates in real-time to identify bottlenecks and optimize customer journeys.
• *Intent detection and automated guidance:* Use AI to detect customer intent and provide automated guidance, making the process more efficient and user-friendly.
• *Personalized enrollment journeys:* Use data-driven insights to create personalized experiences for each customer.
• *Auto-optimize forms suggestion*.

With the renewal - they got the EDS license and planned to be future ready - and thus move to CC (based on discussion last year). Their forms are simple - we could evaluate if they would want to move to EDS directly..
First Bank Peurto Rico is live on CS, renewed on 1st May, having 100K Submissions per year
I have asked them - if they have seen the new features shown in summit, and any particular features they would be interested in (the motivation on moving to CC).  TAM is yet to get back on the same.

They are *First Bank Puerto Rico :* <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/personal/homepage.html>

Here is the info from TAM:

1. *The number of forms currently in use:* Forms that work as form, connected via API to Drupal or Velocify: About 30 forms. Many are few fields (less than 10). The biggest form is this one (in both languages) - <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/simple-forms/long/pr/es/leadform.html> (direct url to form)
2. *URL's to any forms in use:*
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/simple-forms/long/pr/es/leadform.html> (direct url to form)
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/formulario-de-captacion.html> (same form but inside site container).
 *3. Are any custom components currently in use?* We have 3 decision form (no fields) that work as a decision tool for the account or credit cards. Those are part of the code we already share. There are 6 of them (3 spanish, 3 english).

    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/decision-tree/es/dt-saving-es.html> (direct url)
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/personal/cuentas/cuentas-de-cheques.html> (sites page)

are they on AMS/CS ?

I think we should be creating documents to answer their questions and update them later in our documentation
Any updates on Charles or are we blocked on some POC ?
IMO they can create a custom profile for static forms with param mfDisablePagination
<@W6CBB4953> They mentioned that most of their forms are static..

Caching : The caching was removed as data merge on the client was taking too much time, but that was 2013. The browsers and devices have improved a lot since then. We never tried it after that 
Pagination: we had the support for that, mfDisablePagination but if the content is dynamic based on scripts and data, it will not solve their issue

1. Simplification and Document Management: The primary requirement is the simplification and improved management of documents, which is currently lacking in the desktop designer. This presents an opportunity to emphasize the benefits of transitioning to a cloud-based solution.
2. Feature Satisfaction: They are satisfied with the features of the desktop designer.
3. Labeling Needs: They seek a new labeling solution to replace their current system, <https://www.satoamerica.com/resources/software/label-sofware/nice-label#:~:text=The%20NiceLabel%20designer%20delivers%20a,of%20barcoding%20or%20designer%20training.|NiceLabel>. We can highlight that Desktop Designer already support label creation.
4. Complex Document Workflow: Their current document workflow is complex, and they believe it is not optimised. They are looking for our recommended workflow to streamline their processes.

*Update from Customer*
• During the next 2 weeks, they will evaluate the solution functionally. 
• Post June 2, they will revert.

> Have we looked at logs for PDF preview issue ? Nothing in logs to suggest something ?
The logs do not provide a clear indication of the root cause, displaying only a generic message: *"incorrect Template."* As a result, we have requested either the XDP file or access to their Dev2 environment for further investigation.
During the meeting, we attempted to isolate the issue by removing and re-adding various fragments. The template previewed correctly in those cases, suggesting that this may be a specific scenario.

<@W4R5LUPK3>: Thanks for sharing this - Included the JAVA API doc in the mail thread.

<@U0213T59LMN> NFCU is seeking an update on the same, I have included you in the email, need to share a sample implementation on their usecase
1. Member submits the Form with the data, initial validations of the data for correctness are done
2. After submission, we make a call to generate JWT token using environment specific credentials
3. Using the JWT from step#2, and additional auth parameters, next API call is made including the submitted data to the service provider.
4. Submitted data needs to be reformatted to include API parameters in the body and create a custom JSON object with the data that was submitted.
5. Handle the standard response.
6. All the work needs to happen in the background, not the client browser.
